challenge_your_mind: Challenge your mind with the classic number puzzle
select_difficulty_start: Select difficulty and start the game
sudoku_solved: You successfully solved the Sudoku puzzle!
sudoku_history: Sudoku was inspired by the 18th-century Swiss mathematician Leonhard Euler's work on 'Latin Squares'. The modern version was designed in 1979 by American Howard Garns under the name 'Number Place', then gained huge popularity in Japan in 1984 under the name 'Sudoku' (the number must be single). Since 2005, it has become one of the most beloved puzzles worldwide.
rule_1: Each row of the 9Ã—9 grid must contain the numbers 1-9 exactly once.
rule_2: Each column must also contain the numbers 1-9 exactly once.
rule_3: Each 3Ã—3 box must not repeat the numbers 1-9.
rule_4: Use the pre-placed numbers as clues to fill in the empty cells.

vs_friend_desc: Play face to face on the same phone
vs_bot_desc: Challenge the AI at 4 difficulty levels
reversi_history: Reversi was invented in 1883 by either Lewis Waterman or John W. Mollett in England. The modern version, marketed as Othello, was popularized in 1971 by Japanese game enthusiast Goro Hasegawa. Its simple rules but deep strategy made it one of the most popular board games worldwide.
reversi_rule_1: Black always moves first. Players take turns placing discs on the board.
reversi_rule_2: You must place your disc so that it flanks one or more of your opponent's discs between your new disc and another disc of your color.
reversi_rule_3: All flanked opponent discs are flipped to your color.
reversi_rule_4: If you cannot make a valid move, your turn is skipped. The game ends when neither player can move.
